    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1761 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Replace Hsieh/FNV/Penn hash functions with City/Murmur3/Spooky.
    
    Hsieh/FNV/Penn don't perform particularly well in the SMHasher suite of
    tests (see https://code.google.com/p/smhasher/). The new hash functions
    benchmark favorably in terms of speed and hashing characteristics such
    as avalanching, uniformity, etc.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1760 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Change flagcache rebucketing strategy to use load factor.
    
    The original implementation simply increased the number of buckets every
    time realloc_object_flag_bitmasks was called, whether or not more
    buckets were actually needed. This function is called repeatedly at
    startup when the initial flags/powers are being setup. As an example of
    the impact this causes, some data from M*U*S*H:
    - The power flagcache has 211 buckets but only 48 unique entries.
    - The flag flagcache has 1361 buckets but only 557 unique entries.
    
    The new rebucketing strategy uses the load factor of the hash table to
    determine when the number of buckets needs to be increased. This should
    give better memory utilization without adversely affecting lookup
    performance. The hash function has also been changed to the Hsieh hash,
    which should give a more uniform distribution.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1759 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Constify some constants in flags.c and fix up the resulting warnings.

    Hopefully this will fix issue 840 once and for all...

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1812 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move notify_* and signal handling functions to their own headers.
    
    This lets several files stop depending on externs.h at all. Yay!
    Final projects on this list at the moment are merging ansi.h and

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@117 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Initial google code commit.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Run make indent (It's been a while since it was run on the full source)
    Millisecond timing in bsd.c (#1220)
    
    * Millisecond timing in bsd.c for poll() and family.
    * Descriptor quota fixes and improvements
    * Adjust timer.c to use milliseconds.
    * Fixed msec_diff to actually return millisecond count.
    * Rearranging do_second(), every_second(), etc from cque and timer since they're not run every second.
    * Fixing queue_load_record to be aware it probably won't run every second.
    * Cleanup of timeval, slice timeout, and related math in bsd.c
    * Moved error and signal result checking in bsd.c into its own function for cleaner shovechars()
    * moved gettimeofday into utils.c and made generally available as penn_gettimeofday()
    * Add now_msecs(), only used by timer.c now but will be used by @wait/etc.
    Strip markup from fetch_ufun_attrib() argument
    run make indent
    Replace many uses of upcasestr() with strupper_r()
    
    Including one case where a const char * was being modified.
    Run make indent.
    Fix some of the new warnings generated by gcc 8.1
    Replace uses of sprintf() with snprintf()
    Revert "Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct"
    
    This reverts commit 2fca82944d9010d35d9afcebf4e711459ba62a32.
    
    It's causing way too many subtle problems. Revist later.
    Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct
    
    Had a BUFFER_LEN long string in it, and every allocated struct had a 16K
    array of uint16_t's. Both of those are now only as long as they need to
    be.
    Shrink the size of NEW_PE_INFO.
    
    This struct had 3 BUFFER_LEN long strings in it. They're now pointers to
    strings instead of being direclty embedded, and when allocated, they're
    only as big as they need to be. Saves memory on queue-happy code.
    Tweak RNG seeding again.
    Run make indent
    Clean up RNG seeding and prefer rdrnd and getentropy() over /dev/urandom when available.
    Run make indent
    Use BCryptGenRandom() to seed the RNG instead of CryptGenRandom()
    Fix a bunch of warnings on MinGW
    Replace the SFMT RNG with PCG.
    
    The latter is much smaller in size, faster, and performs better on
    randomness tests.
    Fix a bunch of valgrind warnings about uninitialized memory.
    
    Most of these only happen with SSE4.2 paths; make sure that strings that
    they load have enough trailing 0 bytes to avoid reading other things
    memory. A side effect is a new mush_malloc_zero() function (Though I
    suppose mush_calloc() would have worked just as well.)
    
    Plus fix a few related bugs in building and checking the pollfd array in bsd.c,
    and make scanning the results slightly more efficient.
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Use a better seed for the RNG on Windows.
    Upgrade SFMT to 1.5.1
    Add memory checking to safe_atr_value, plug a leak in LISTENs.
    Run make indent
    configure cleanup.
    Make unsetq() and @include/clearregs more reliable. Fixes issue 795. I hope.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    owner() now accepts an optional second and third argument, to change ownership.
    link() now returns 0 on failure, 1 on success when used as side-effect function.
    Fix issue #1190 - issues with clone
    Replace uses of sprintf() with snprintf()
    @entrances and friends use a sql table.
    Inital attr-arrays checkin: Store attributes on objects in arrays, not linked lists.
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Add memory checking to safe_atr_value, plug a leak in LISTENs.
    Cloning an old-style exit didn't copy its alias to the ALIAS attr properly.
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.

    Initial google code commit.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Update Sqlite3 to 3.32.3 (#1340)
    Update to Sqlite 3.32.1 (#1332)
    
    * Update sqlite to 3.32.1
    
    * Use the new standard sqlite uint collation extension.
    
    For sorting strings with embedded numbers. Replaces Raevnos's homebrewed
    version.
    Update to Sqlite 3.29.0 (#1311)
    Sqlite 328 (#1298)
    
    * Sqlite3 usage improvements
    
    * Turn on the sqlite error logging feature.
    * Cleanly close open data bases on shutdown - eliminates some valgrind
      warnings.
    * Fix some errors found by turning on sqlite logging.
    
    * Sync up sqlite3 spellfix module with upstream.
    
    Also reduce completely off the wall suggestions for functions/help/commands
    a bit.
    
    * Tweak sqlite options a bit for performance and safety
    
    * Update to SQLite 3.28
    
    * Add a routine to check sql databases for corruption issues.
    Update sqlite to 3.27.1
    Sqlite 325 (#1268)
    
    * Update Sqlite to 3.25.3
    
    * Fix a memory leak when opening a sqlite database fails.
    
    * More sqlite leak fixes, and better error messages.
    Sqlite 3.25 Update (#1244)
    
    * Update to Sqlite 3.25
    
    * Rewrite help entries generation.
    
    Using new sqlite window functions make it a lot cleaner and simpler.
    
    * Drop an index that's no longer needed from the help db.
    
    * Close open sqlite3 file databases before forking.
    
    Leaving a db open across a fork and then accessing it from the child is
    a good way to get a corrupt database. While we don't do anything after a
    fork that would use an open db connection, that might change in the
    future, and it's better to be safe than sorry anyways. Right now they're
    only reopened in the parent. In the future if a child needs access to a
    db too it can be set up to automatically reopen as well.
    
    * Update to Sqlite 3.25.1
    Upgrade Sqlite to 3.24
    Suppress gcc 8 warnings in sqlite3.c
    Bump sqlite3 to 3.23.1
    Update sqlite3 to 3.23.0
    Try to stop gcc warnings in sqlite3.c
    A few sqlite3 config tweaks.
    Add Sqlite3 3.22 to Penn source.
    Sqlite 325 (#1268)
    
    * Update Sqlite to 3.25.3
    
    * Fix a memory leak when opening a sqlite database fails.
    
    * More sqlite leak fixes, and better error messages.
    Add year and week formats to etimefmt(). Closes #804
    Add a way for prepare_statement to bypass the cache.
    run make indent
    Use VALUES instead of SELECT for just getting the result of a sql function.
    Add timecalc() and secscalc() functions.
    Run make indent.
    Replace uses of sprintf() with snprintf()
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Ignore Tiny_Math when checking for uints internally, or things go boom.
    Allow using text labels instead of a bitflag for the monikers config option, and other minor configy tweaks. Fixes #1089.
    Run make indent
    Allow negative times for isdaylight().
    Allow negative times for timefmt() when possible.
    Allow negative inputs for convsecs(), have convtime() return #-1 on error. Fixes #1010.
    configure cleanup.
    Fix bugs in @include, registers() and the like making registers available at the wrong times, make PE_REGS_ARGPASS/NEWATTR more reliably checked, and document some of the register getting hardcode functions. Fixes issue 818. If we're lucky.

    Move notify_* and signal handling functions to their own headers.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.

    Make more string constants more const.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1792 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Fix stack overflow in chat_player_announce.
    
    If there are no channels, then bp is never advanced, so bp -= 3 ends up
    pointing to an invalid location on the stack.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move memcheck functions to their own header.
    
    There's no reason to dump all the prototypes into externs.h. Also
    improve #include hygenie in affected .c files by using the following
    order for #includes:
    1) #include "config.h", "copyrite.h", and the corresponding .h file, if
       any, first.
    2) Then include any system headers (e.g. <stddef.h>)
    3) Finally, everything else, sorted in alphabetical order.
    
    This forces headers to #include everything they depend on rather than on
    depending on the .c files to randomly #include things in the right
    order. It also helps enforce that the prototypes in the .h file match
    the implementations in the .c files.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1772 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1770 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    commit d332b91d65a649a992b2f1c95d5209557adb4493
    Author: Shawn Wagner <shawnw.mobile@gmail.com>
    Date:   Wed Aug 15 15:10:08 2018 -0700
    
        Add /brief to help search and support @ in tokens. #1225
    Trigger inline (WIP) (#1219)
    
    Add @trigger/inline and /match
    Httpd (#1214)
    
    (From "help http"):
    PennMUSH now supports HTTP requests reaching its mush port. It is very low level,
    and a little tricky to understand.
    
    When an HTTP request hits the PennMUSH port, PennMUSH invisibly logs in to
    the HTTP Handler player (@config http_handler), and executes an
    @include me/<method>. e.g: @include me/get.
    
    %0 will be the pathname, e.g: "/", "/path/to", "/foo?bar=baz", etc.
    
    %1 will be the body of the request. If it's json, use json_query to deal with it.
    If it's form-encoded, look at help formdecode()
    
    Anything sent to the HTTP Handler player during evaluation of this code is
    included in the body sent to the HTTP Client. There is a maximum size of
    BUFFER_LEN for the body of the response.
    @fetch supports PUT requests.
    Add experimental support for HTTP-auth, and POST requests.
    
    Plus some setting of limits and timeouts.
    Issue 1117: Add @dump/nofork
    Add GENERATE sw to @newpassword
    Allow searching the helpfiles via help/search and textsearch() functions.
    Add \@if from Rhost/MUX.
    Add /trim and /rotate switches to @logwipe
    Add @hook/extend. Change hooks internally to be pointers to structs, instead of always allocating the structs even if there's no hook set.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move memcheck functions to their own header.
    
    There's no reason to dump all the prototypes into externs.h. Also
    improve #include hygenie in affected .c files by using the following
    order for #includes:
    1) #include "config.h", "copyrite.h", and the corresponding .h file, if
       any, first.
    2) Then include any system headers (e.g. <stddef.h>)
    3) Finally, everything else, sorted in alphabetical order.
    
    This forces headers to #include everything they depend on rather than on
    depending on the .c files to randomly #include things in the right
    order. It also helps enforce that the prototypes in the .h file match
    the implementations in the .c files.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1772 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    Log fixups (#1249)
    
    * Use ISO-8601 timestamps for log messages.
    
    * Replace some stray perror() calls with penn_perror() wrappers.
    
    * Replace some direct writes to stderr with log function calls, and put timestamps in more.
    
    * Timestamp libevent log messages in info_slave and ssl_slave
    
    * Fix warning in sig.c re penn_perror()
    
    * Log changes broke test suite.
    
    * Eliminate some duplicate brackets in log messages.
    Redirect stdout to a log file instead of closing it.
    
    Closing it could sometimes cause massive CPU spikes when fd 1 was reused
    for a socket or something else and some library tries to write to
    stdout.

    PCRE1 to PCRE2 (#1230)
    
    * Convert from PCRE1 to PCRE2
    
    * Fix install path for pcre2
    
    * Link directly to the bundled libpcre2-8.a file.
    
    System ones were sometimes getting picked up instead if present. Ours is
    better.
    
    * Compile sitelock wildcard patterns into regular expressions.
    
    * Speed up atr_iter_get() and friends:
    
    1. Precompile regular expressions before scanning attributes.
    2. Convert wildcard patterns to REs and compile same.
    
    * Make the sqlite REGEXP match actually anchored like it's supposed to be.
    
    * Remove some references to PCRE as a dependency from documentation.
    
    * Fix a timestamp issue that was causing odd things when building pcre2 on some systems. Also avoid re-installing it unless needed.
    
    * Add changelog entry.
    
    * Have the configure script download a pcre2 tarball instead of including it directly in the Penn repo.
    
    Addresses the bloat issue in a hopefully portable way.
    
    * Use http instead of https because the latter isn't always supported.
    
    * Update to pcre2 10.32, misc tweaks.
    Hardcode Tests (#1243)
    
    * Add basic hardcode test framework. Closes #1238
    
    Now go forth and write all the tests!
    
    * Rename all the softcode test case files.
    
    testFOO.pl -> testFOO.t because they're not actually proper perl scripts
    and that was bugging me and causing syntax highlighting problems in
    editors.
    
    * Fix a couple of typos/formatting bugs.
    
    * Add some more test cases.
    
    * Add some utf8 tests.
    
    * Support ancient perl, and better error handling on failed tsort invocation.
    
    * More tests and run the tests after loading the database.
    
    * Add tests for map_file()
    Run make indent (It's been a while since it was run on the full source)

    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.

    Move memcheck functions to their own header.
    
    There's no reason to dump all the prototypes into externs.h. Also
    improve #include hygenie in affected .c files by using the following
    order for #includes:
    1) #include "config.h", "copyrite.h", and the corresponding .h file, if
       any, first.
    2) Then include any system headers (e.g. <stddef.h>)
    3) Finally, everything else, sorted in alphabetical order.
    
    This forces headers to #include everything they depend on rather than on
    depending on the .c files to randomly #include things in the right
    order. It also helps enforce that the prototypes in the .h file match
    the implementations in the .c files.

    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.

    Sqlite 328 (#1298)
    
    * Sqlite3 usage improvements
    
    * Turn on the sqlite error logging feature.
    * Cleanly close open data bases on shutdown - eliminates some valgrind
      warnings.
    * Fix some errors found by turning on sqlite logging.
    
    * Sync up sqlite3 spellfix module with upstream.
    
    Also reduce completely off the wall suggestions for functions/help/commands
    a bit.
    
    * Tweak sqlite options a bit for performance and safety
    
    * Update to SQLite 3.28
    
    * Add a routine to check sql databases for corruption issues.
    Sqlite 325 (#1268)
    
    * Update Sqlite to 3.25.3
    
    * Fix a memory leak when opening a sqlite database fails.
    
    * More sqlite leak fixes, and better error messages.
    Fix a bug passing an invalid pointer to sqlite3_exec (introduced in sqlite-325) (#1251)
    Sqlite 3.25 Update (#1244)
    
    * Update to Sqlite 3.25
    
    * Rewrite help entries generation.
    
    Using new sqlite window functions make it a lot cleaner and simpler.
    
    * Drop an index that's no longer needed from the help db.
    
    * Close open sqlite3 file databases before forking.
    
    Leaving a db open across a fork and then accessing it from the child is
    a good way to get a corrupt database. While we don't do anything after a
    fork that would use an open db connection, that might change in the
    future, and it's better to be safe than sorry anyways. Right now they're
    only reopened in the parent. In the future if a child needs access to a
    db too it can be set up to automatically reopen as well.
    
    * Update to Sqlite 3.25.1

    Httpd (#1214)
    
    (From "help http"):
    PennMUSH now supports HTTP requests reaching its mush port. It is very low level,
    and a little tricky to understand.
    
    When an HTTP request hits the PennMUSH port, PennMUSH invisibly logs in to
    the HTTP Handler player (@config http_handler), and executes an
    @include me/<method>. e.g: @include me/get.
    
    %0 will be the pathname, e.g: "/", "/path/to", "/foo?bar=baz", etc.
    
    %1 will be the body of the request. If it's json, use json_query to deal with it.
    If it's form-encoded, look at help formdecode()
    
    Anything sent to the HTTP Handler player during evaluation of this code is
    included in the body sent to the HTTP Client. There is a maximum size of
    BUFFER_LEN for the body of the response.
    @fetch supports PUT requests.
    Add experimental support for HTTP-auth, and POST requests.
    
    Plus some setting of limits and timeouts.
    Issue 1117: Add @dump/nofork
    Add helpfile for @newpass/generate. No point adding stuff if noone can find how to use it, people.
    Allow searching the helpfiles via help/search and textsearch() functions.
    Add \@if from Rhost/MUX.
    Add /trim and /rotate switches to @logwipe
    Add @hook/extend. Change hooks internally to be pointers to structs, instead of always allocating the structs even if there's no hook set.

    PCRE1 to PCRE2 (#1230)
    
    * Convert from PCRE1 to PCRE2
    
    * Fix install path for pcre2
    
    * Link directly to the bundled libpcre2-8.a file.
    
    System ones were sometimes getting picked up instead if present. Ours is
    better.
    
    * Compile sitelock wildcard patterns into regular expressions.
    
    * Speed up atr_iter_get() and friends:
    
    1. Precompile regular expressions before scanning attributes.
    2. Convert wildcard patterns to REs and compile same.
    
    * Make the sqlite REGEXP match actually anchored like it's supposed to be.
    
    * Remove some references to PCRE as a dependency from documentation.
    
    * Fix a timestamp issue that was causing odd things when building pcre2 on some systems. Also avoid re-installing it unless needed.
    
    * Add changelog entry.
    
    * Have the configure script download a pcre2 tarball instead of including it directly in the Penn repo.
    
    Addresses the bloat issue in a hopefully portable way.
    
    * Use http instead of https because the latter isn't always supported.
    
    * Update to pcre2 10.32, misc tweaks.
    Single queue, and massive bsd.c rewrite (#1224)
    
    WARNING! With the removal of the object queue, please be careful when upgrading that you do
     not have any infinitely looping triggers without an `@wait`.
    
    As an example, this used to be a common way to ensure something was executed once per second:
    
    > `&everysecond object=do some ; updates ; @trigger me/everysecond`
    
    This will now happen, up to several thousand times per second! Make it `@wait 1`, and it'll run once/second!
    
    * A single command queue for players and objects. No more `@trigger` waits. [GM]
    * A restructuring of bsd.c, to make it easier to reason about Penn's queue cycle. [GM]
    
    On the way to doing this:
    
    * cpu_timer_hit checks in atr_iter* and regexp loops (Ashen-Shugar can hang Penn for a full second w/ regrab on a single attr. Never mind max_attrs!)
    * Removal of active_q_chunk - I don't think it makes much sense to have it. Instead we just run queue_chunk every loop.
    Fix some of the new warnings generated by gcc 8.1
    Revert "Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct"
    
    This reverts commit 2fca82944d9010d35d9afcebf4e711459ba62a32.
    
    It's causing way too many subtle problems. Revist later.
    Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct
    
    Had a BUFFER_LEN long string in it, and every allocated struct had a 16K
    array of uint16_t's. Both of those are now only as long as they need to
    be.
    Revert "Move assorted feature test macros out of assorted files into config.h."
    
    This reverts commit 193224d9937268fb0e7caf3ea0dbf19f0f9ef183.
    Move assorted feature test macros out of assorted files into config.h.
    
    Based on one of the things in the patch in issue #916.
    Run make indent
    Replace the SFMT RNG with PCG.
    
    The latter is much smaller in size, faster, and performs better on
    randomness tests.
    Fix a bunch of valgrind warnings about uninitialized memory.
    
    Most of these only happen with SSE4.2 paths; make sure that strings that
    they load have enough trailing 0 bytes to avoid reading other things
    memory. A side effect is a new mush_malloc_zero() function (Though I
    suppose mush_calloc() would have worked just as well.)
    
    Plus fix a few related bugs in building and checking the pollfd array in bsd.c,
    and make scanning the results slightly more efficient.
    Have fold() pass the number of times <attr> has been called as %2.
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Issue 1119: table() smarter about filling lines.
    Stop elements() spitting out extra delim with bad first position. Fixes issue #1108.
    Fix an ANSI bug in regrab().
    Fix a bug in first() and a crashbug in rest() related to changes in issue #1048.
    Run make indent
    extract() with one arg incorrectly returned the 2nd element, not the 1st.
    Fix a crashbug in the fold() changes, caused b-- reported by Qon.
    Stop splice() stripping ANSI. Closes #1045.

    Fix some oddness in fun_itemize

    Alias element() to match(). Fixes #985.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Fix memory leak in extract()
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1775 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move memcheck functions to their own header.
    
    There's no reason to dump all the prototypes into externs.h. Also
    improve #include hygenie in affected .c files by using the following
    order for #includes:
    1) #include "config.h", "copyrite.h", and the corresponding .h file, if
       any, first.
    2) Then include any system headers (e.g. <stddef.h>)
    3) Finally, everything else, sorted in alphabetical order.
    
    This forces headers to #include everything they depend on rather than on
    depending on the .c files to randomly #include things in the right
    order. It also helps enforce that the prototypes in the .h file match
    the implementations in the .c files.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1772 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    Most of these only happen with SSE4.2 paths; make sure that strings that
    they load have enough trailing 0 bytes to avoid reading other things

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1812 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1770 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    Log fixups (#1249)
    
    * Use ISO-8601 timestamps for log messages.
    
    * Replace some stray perror() calls with penn_perror() wrappers.
    
    * Replace some direct writes to stderr with log function calls, and put timestamps in more.
    
    * Timestamp libevent log messages in info_slave and ssl_slave
    
    * Fix warning in sig.c re penn_perror()
    
    * Log changes broke test suite.
    
    * Eliminate some duplicate brackets in log messages.
    Replace the SFMT RNG with PCG.
    
    The latter is much smaller in size, faster, and performs better on
    randomness tests.
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Fix compilation errors on systems using OpenSSL 1.1
    Run a make indent and distdepend.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1894 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Update hash table implementation to only use CityHash.
    
    Instead of switching hash functions altogether, we just use different
    seeds for CityHash. This isn't perfect since there is correlation
    between the resulting hashes (https://131002.net/siphash/ contains more
    details). The next hash table patch will update the bucket selection
    algorithm to use a (2, 4) hashing scheme to try to improve space/cache
    utilization, as well as improving lookup times.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1834 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Use ULL integer suffix instead of LLU.
    
    Apparently Visual C++ only accepts the former even though the standard
    states that either suffix is OK.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1832 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Run a make indent.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1812 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Make sure hash_stats zeros its result struct.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1777 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Add some prototypes to htab.c temporarily to avoid breaking compile.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1771 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1770 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    This prevents other modules from depending on hash table internals.
    Link-time optimization will still allow functions to be inlined as
    needed.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1764 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Replace Hsieh/FNV/Penn hash functions with City/Murmur3/Spooky.
    
    Hsieh/FNV/Penn don't perform particularly well in the SMHasher suite of
    tests (see https://code.google.com/p/smhasher/). The new hash functions
    benchmark favorably in terms of speed and hashing characteristics such
    as avalanching, uniformity, etc.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1760 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Change flagcache rebucketing strategy to use load factor.
    
    The original implementation simply increased the number of buckets every
    time realloc_object_flag_bitmasks was called, whether or not more
    buckets were actually needed. This function is called repeatedly at
    startup when the initial flags/powers are being setup. As an example of
    the impact this causes, some data from M*U*S*H:
    - The power flagcache has 211 buckets but only 48 unique entries.
    - The flag flagcache has 1361 buckets but only 557 unique entries.
    
    The new rebucketing strategy uses the load factor of the hash table to
    determine when the number of buckets needs to be increased. This should
    give better memory utilization without adversely affecting lookup
    performance. The hash function has also been changed to the Hsieh hash,
    which should give a more uniform distribution.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1759 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Add missing paramaters to function comment docs.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Sqlite 328 (#1298)
    
    * Sqlite3 usage improvements
    
    * Turn on the sqlite error logging feature.
    * Cleanly close open data bases on shutdown - eliminates some valgrind
      warnings.
    * Fix some errors found by turning on sqlite logging.
    
    * Sync up sqlite3 spellfix module with upstream.
    
    Also reduce completely off the wall suggestions for functions/help/commands
    a bit.
    
    * Tweak sqlite options a bit for performance and safety
    
    * Update to SQLite 3.28
    
    * Add a routine to check sql databases for corruption issues.
    Sqlite 325 (#1268)
    
    * Update Sqlite to 3.25.3
    
    * Fix a memory leak when opening a sqlite database fails.
    
    * More sqlite leak fixes, and better error messages.
    Sqlite 3.25 Update (#1244)
    
    * Update to Sqlite 3.25
    
    * Rewrite help entries generation.
    
    Using new sqlite window functions make it a lot cleaner and simpler.
    
    * Drop an index that's no longer needed from the help db.
    
    * Close open sqlite3 file databases before forking.
    
    Leaving a db open across a fork and then accessing it from the child is
    a good way to get a corrupt database. While we don't do anything after a
    fork that would use an open db connection, that might change in the
    future, and it's better to be safe than sorry anyways. Right now they're
    only reopened in the parent. In the future if a child needs access to a
    db too it can be set up to automatically reopen as well.
    
    * Update to Sqlite 3.25.1
    Squashed commit of the following:

    Author: Shawn <shawnw.mobile@gmail.com>

        Use PCRE for sqlite regexp operator.

    Move notify_* and signal handling functions to their own headers.
    
    This lets several files stop depending on externs.h at all. Yay!

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1770 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Update to Sqlite 3.32.1 (#1332)
    
    * Update sqlite to 3.32.1
    
    * Use the new standard sqlite uint collation extension.
    
    For sorting strings with embedded numbers. Replaces Raevnos's homebrewed
    version.
    Sqlite 325 (#1268)
    
    * Update Sqlite to 3.25.3
    
    * Fix a memory leak when opening a sqlite database fails.
    
    * More sqlite leak fixes, and better error messages.
    Misc windows fixes (#1261)
    
    * Windows compile error in markup.c
    
    * Fix a warning and bug in mingw builds of timer.c
    
    * Fix some build settings for Windows platforms
    
    Compiling with -fstack-protector was breaking Mingw builds.
    Compiling with PCRE2 JIT was breaking Cygwin. Fixes #1257
    
    * Add a --disable-jit option to configure to always disable JIT checks.
    PCRE1 to PCRE2 (#1230)
    
    * Convert from PCRE1 to PCRE2
    
    * Fix install path for pcre2
    
    * Link directly to the bundled libpcre2-8.a file.
    
    System ones were sometimes getting picked up instead if present. Ours is
    better.
    
    * Compile sitelock wildcard patterns into regular expressions.
    
    * Speed up atr_iter_get() and friends:
    
    1. Precompile regular expressions before scanning attributes.
    2. Convert wildcard patterns to REs and compile same.
    
    * Make the sqlite REGEXP match actually anchored like it's supposed to be.
    
    * Remove some references to PCRE as a dependency from documentation.
    
    * Fix a timestamp issue that was causing odd things when building pcre2 on some systems. Also avoid re-installing it unless needed.
    
    * Add changelog entry.
    
    * Have the configure script download a pcre2 tarball instead of including it directly in the Penn repo.
    
    Addresses the bloat issue in a hopefully portable way.
    
    * Use http instead of https because the latter isn't always supported.
    
    * Update to pcre2 10.32, misc tweaks.
    Externalizing the list of named colors (#1237)
    
    * Add API for memory-mapping a file.
    
    * Load color names and data from an external file.
    
    ... instead of being in a header file. Makes it much easier to add your
    own colors or otherwise modify the list.
    
    * Store the RGB color codes in colors.json as hex strings instead of base10 integers.
    
    Suggested by Mercutio.
    
    * Convert from Windows to Unix line endings. Oops.
    
    * Also use map_file() for reading connect.txt etc.
    
    Simplifies fcache_read() a lot.
    
    * Add changelog entry.
    Add a way for prepare_statement to bypass the cache.
    run make indent
    Clean up and optimize some queries and tables.
    Add versioning to help database file
    Get rid of uses of tprintf()
    
    Leave the function marked as deprecated to avoid breaking third-party
    code that uses it.
    
    Functions that return static buffers must die!
    Run make indent.
    Fix some of the new warnings generated by gcc 8.1
    Might have cleaned too much.
    Cleanup and bug fixes.
    Clean up some queries and add comments.
    Clean up formatting of some sqlite3_exec calls.
    Revert "Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct"
    
    This reverts commit 2fca82944d9010d35d9afcebf4e711459ba62a32.
    
    It's causing way too many subtle problems. Revist later.
    Fix safe_ansi_string() bug where it could try to read out of bounds.
    Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct
    
    Had a BUFFER_LEN long string in it, and every allocated struct had a 16K
    array of uint16_t's. Both of those are now only as long as they need to
    be.
    Use ICU for utf8 <-> latin1 translations when available.
    Tweak some SQL queries.
    colors(name) does wildcard searching in SQL select.
    Split the big giant string of color descriptions into an array of shorter ones.
    Add collator to properly sort things like xterm color names.
    Move color tables into sqlite3.
    Run make indent
    Further work on issue #1147
    allow tags without pueblo and use SUPPORT_HTML
    Remove xtermN colors from the rgb to name map. Again.
    Stop colors() without a wildcard from listing xtermN colors again.
    Use a newer version of gperf for rgbtab.c, fix a typo. Oops.
    For issue 1112: Support Rhost style colors() key arguments.
    Replace the SFMT RNG with PCG.
    
    The latter is much smaller in size, faster, and performs better on
    randomness tests.
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Fix some spurious warnings in gcc 7.1
    Rebuild static hash tables with gperf 3.1
    Run make indent
    Rename Pueblo_Send to Send_OOB, change user perms for oob(). Closes #1041.
    Add parsing of raw xterm tags for spork. Closes #975.
    Make colors(...,auto) more robust (AKA not broken, hopefully).
    Add colors(...,auto), returning output in the same style as the input.
    Run make indent

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1812 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove unused macros.
    
    Found with Clang's -Wunused-macros. Note that not all warnings found
    were addressed. Macros that looked like part of a set were left alone,
    such as the telnet IAC and GA macros in notify.c.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    PCRE1 to PCRE2 (#1230)
    
    * Convert from PCRE1 to PCRE2
    
    * Fix install path for pcre2
    
    * Link directly to the bundled libpcre2-8.a file.
    
    System ones were sometimes getting picked up instead if present. Ours is
    better.
    
    * Compile sitelock wildcard patterns into regular expressions.
    
    * Speed up atr_iter_get() and friends:
    
    1. Precompile regular expressions before scanning attributes.
    2. Convert wildcard patterns to REs and compile same.
    
    * Make the sqlite REGEXP match actually anchored like it's supposed to be.
    
    * Remove some references to PCRE as a dependency from documentation.
    
    * Fix a timestamp issue that was causing odd things when building pcre2 on some systems. Also avoid re-installing it unless needed.
    
    * Add changelog entry.
    
    * Have the configure script download a pcre2 tarball instead of including it directly in the Penn repo.
    
    Addresses the bloat issue in a hopefully portable way.
    
    * Use http instead of https because the latter isn't always supported.
    
    * Update to pcre2 10.32, misc tweaks.
    Single queue, and massive bsd.c rewrite (#1224)
    
    WARNING! With the removal of the object queue, please be careful when upgrading that you do
     not have any infinitely looping triggers without an `@wait`.
    
    As an example, this used to be a common way to ensure something was executed once per second:
    
    > `&everysecond object=do some ; updates ; @trigger me/everysecond`
    
    This will now happen, up to several thousand times per second! Make it `@wait 1`, and it'll run once/second!
    
    * A single command queue for players and objects. No more `@trigger` waits. [GM]
    * A restructuring of bsd.c, to make it easier to reason about Penn's queue cycle. [GM]
    
    On the way to doing this:
    
    * cpu_timer_hit checks in atr_iter* and regexp loops (Ashen-Shugar can hang Penn for a full second w/ regrab on a single attr. Never mind max_attrs!)
    * Removal of active_q_chunk - I don't think it makes much sense to have it. Instead we just run queue_chunk every loop.
    run make indent
    Fix a bug in utf-8 input processing and try to be more intelligent about turning unicode characters into ascii/latin-1 equivalents.
    Replace many uses of upcasestr() with strupper_r()
    
    Including one case where a const char * was being modified.
    Get rid of uses of tprintf()
    
    Leave the function marked as deprecated to avoid breaking third-party
    code that uses it.
    
    Functions that return static buffers must die!
    Run make indent.
    Combine a couple of atr_iter_get() arguments into one.
    Revert "Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct"
    
    This reverts commit 2fca82944d9010d35d9afcebf4e711459ba62a32.
    
    It's causing way too many subtle problems. Revist later.
    Shrink the size of the ansi_string struct
    
    Had a BUFFER_LEN long string in it, and every allocated struct had a 16K
    array of uint16_t's. Both of those are now only as long as they need to
    be.
    Run make indent
    Pass pe_info into IDLE and HAVEN attributes from the page command.
    Issue 1120: @grep/iprint preserves case in display.
    Run make indent
    Disallow '=' in passwords
    Fix a bunch of valgrind warnings about uninitialized memory.
    
    Most of these only happen with SSE4.2 paths; make sure that strings that
    they load have enough trailing 0 bytes to avoid reading other things
    memory. A side effect is a new mush_malloc_zero() function (Though I
    suppose mush_calloc() would have worked just as well.)
    
    Plus fix a few related bugs in building and checking the pollfd array in bsd.c,
    and make scanning the results slightly more efficient.
    Fix a bunch of warnings about duplicate variable names found with -Wshadow
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Run make indent
    Rename Pueblo_Send to Send_OOB, change user perms for oob(). Closes #1041.
    Add pgrep() and @grep/parent, for grepping inherited attributes. Issue #1023
    Run make indent
    Fix a memory leak in @switch.
    configure cleanup.
    Run make indent

    Run a make indent.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1812 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move memcheck functions to their own header.
    
    There's no reason to dump all the prototypes into externs.h. Also
    improve #include hygenie in affected .c files by using the following
    order for #includes:
    1) #include "config.h", "copyrite.h", and the corresponding .h file, if
       any, first.
    2) Then include any system headers (e.g. <stddef.h>)
    3) Finally, everything else, sorted in alphabetical order.
    
    This forces headers to #include everything they depend on rather than on
    depending on the .c files to randomly #include things in the right
    order. It also helps enforce that the prototypes in the .h file match
    the implementations in the .c files.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1772 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Fix some compile-time warnings from FreeBSD.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.

    * Convert from PCRE1 to PCRE2

    System ones were sometimes getting picked up instead if present. Ours is
    better.

    1. Precompile regular expressions before scanning attributes.
    2. Convert wildcard patterns to REs and compile same.
    
    * Make the sqlite REGEXP match actually anchored like it's supposed to be.

    * Add changelog entry.
    
    * Have the configure script download a pcre2 tarball instead of including it directly in the Penn repo.
    
    Addresses the bloat issue in a hopefully portable way.
    
    * Use http instead of https because the latter isn't always supported.

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1812 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move memcheck functions to their own header.
    
    There's no reason to dump all the prototypes into externs.h. Also
    improve #include hygenie in affected .c files by using the following
    order for #includes:
    1) #include "config.h", "copyrite.h", and the corresponding .h file, if
       any, first.
    2) Then include any system headers (e.g. <stddef.h>)
    3) Finally, everything else, sorted in alphabetical order.
    
    This forces headers to #include everything they depend on rather than on
    depending on the .c files to randomly #include things in the right
    order. It also helps enforce that the prototypes in the .h file match
    the implementations in the .c files.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1772 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1770 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1792 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move notify_* and signal handling functions to their own headers.
    
    This lets several files stop depending on externs.h at all. Yay!

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Constify the tables in the gperf generated files.
    
    Also manually add 'static' to lmathtab.c's lookup function  to silence a
    bunch of warnings about referencing static functions from inline scope.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1780 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1770 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Sqlite 325 (#1268)
    
    * Update Sqlite to 3.25.3
    
    * Fix a memory leak when opening a sqlite database fails.
    
    * More sqlite leak fixes, and better error messages.
    Fix an overflow bug in @search.
    Clean up entrances() a bit.
    run make indent
    Add a table with dbrefs of all non-garbage objects.
    
    Intended to be used as a foreign key with other tables that hold dbrefs so they can delete
    records when that object is destroyed.
    Get rid of uses of tprintf()
    
    Leave the function marked as deprecated to avoid breaking third-party
    code that uses it.
    
    Functions that return static buffers must die!
    Run make indent.
    Eliminate a few uses of tprintf()
    
    I'd like to eventually get rid of all uses of it; functions that return
    pointers to static buffers must die!
    Cleanup and bug fixes.
    @entrances and friends use a sql table.
    Run make indent
    Inital attr-arrays checkin: Store attributes on objects in arrays, not linked lists.
    dbtools initial commit.
    
    See issue #1157.
    
    A Penn DB reading library and assorted utilities. Should currently be
    able to read any database that 1.8.7 can. Support for older versions is
    coming.
    And a few more spots.
    Go back to string prefix matching for lsearch().
    string_prefix() should not be used for exact string matching. See #1151
    Replace the SFMT RNG with PCG.
    
    The latter is much smaller in size, faster, and performs better on
    randomness tests.
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Run make indent
    Add type switches to @chownall to limit types of objects chowned. Issue #1023.
    Run make indent
    Fix sizeof(elems) in @newpassword
    Add GENERATE sw to @newpassword
    Add named arguments to \@hook with command arguments, fix a bug in registers().
    Move some log stuff out of bsd.c.
    configure cleanup.
    Run make indent

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Run make indent.
    Run make indent
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    Move notify_* and signal handling functions to their own headers.
    
    This lets several files stop depending on externs.h at all. Yay!

    markup.h and figuring out a better place for mush_panic*.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1779 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Remove external dependencies from hash table implementation.
    
    The hash table implementation shouldn't have to know about MUSH-specific
    types like dbrefs. Future efforts will focus on removing these
    dependencies from the slab allocator and several other areas. The end
    result is that it will be easier to write test harnesses for core
    components of Penn to make it easier to verify that patches don't
    introduce regressions.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1770 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd

    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Sqlite 328 (#1298)
    
    * Sqlite3 usage improvements
    
    * Turn on the sqlite error logging feature.
    * Cleanly close open data bases on shutdown - eliminates some valgrind
      warnings.
    * Fix some errors found by turning on sqlite logging.
    
    * Sync up sqlite3 spellfix module with upstream.
    
    Also reduce completely off the wall suggestions for functions/help/commands
    a bit.
    
    * Tweak sqlite options a bit for performance and safety
    
    * Update to SQLite 3.28
    
    * Add a routine to check sql databases for corruption issues.
    Add a few more characters to transliteration table.
    Add some hyphens and dashes to unicode to latin1 transliteration
    Add to the spellfix unicode to ascii table.
    Suggest alternative names for unknown functions.
    
    [strlin(foo)] -> FUNCTION (STRLIN) NOT FOUND DID YOU MEAN 'STRLEN'
    
    Uses Sqlite3 spellfix extension.
    lmath()-able versions of lt, gt, lte, gte, eq and neq. And similarly,
    they can now accept more than 2 args.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@73 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Initial google code commit.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@2 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    PCRE1 to PCRE2 (#1230)
    
    * Convert from PCRE1 to PCRE2
    
    * Fix install path for pcre2
    
    * Link directly to the bundled libpcre2-8.a file.
    
    System ones were sometimes getting picked up instead if present. Ours is
    better.
    
    * Compile sitelock wildcard patterns into regular expressions.
    
    * Speed up atr_iter_get() and friends:
    
    1. Precompile regular expressions before scanning attributes.
    2. Convert wildcard patterns to REs and compile same.
    
    * Make the sqlite REGEXP match actually anchored like it's supposed to be.
    
    * Remove some references to PCRE as a dependency from documentation.
    
    * Fix a timestamp issue that was causing odd things when building pcre2 on some systems. Also avoid re-installing it unless needed.
    
    * Add changelog entry.
    
    * Have the configure script download a pcre2 tarball instead of including it directly in the Penn repo.
    
    Addresses the bloat issue in a hopefully portable way.
    
    * Use http instead of https because the latter isn't always supported.
    
    * Update to pcre2 10.32, misc tweaks.
    Run make indent
    Make qcomp_regexp_match() take the length of the string to be searched as an argument.
    Run make indent using clang-format.
    configure cleanup.
    Add a command line flag to disable jit compiling regular expressions, for use with valgrind testing.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1868 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    JIT compile hardcoded PCRE regular expressions when supported.

    markup.h and figuring out a better place for mush_panic*.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1790 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Default char to unsigned to make it harder to write dangerous code.
    
    In the interest of making it harder to shoot yourself in the foot,
    have the compiler treat char as an unsigned type by default to prevent
    things like: char c = '0xF0'; if (some_table[c]) ... from exploding
    spectacularly.
    
    Also constify some things in notify.c that didn't need to be mutable.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1787 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Always include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h.
    
    Files no longer need to include config.h, confmagic.h, and options.h,
    since they are force included in the compile command.  This prevents
    things from breaking if someone (like me) forgets to include options.h
    before including some other file that happens to depend on options.h.
    Ideally, conf.h would be in this set too but it currently has non-config
    stuff in there as well.
    
    This will also break the win32 build until someone updates the project
    files to add the appropriate /FI flags.
    
    git-svn-id: https://pennmush.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@1782 ba372814-4f39-11de-9ad6-1127a62b9fcd
    Move string manipulation functions from externs.h into strutil.h.
    
    Also fixes a bunch of headers to include what they use. This is a
    continuation of the work to clean up core modules like the allocator,
    hash tables, the memory checker, etc so they don't depend on anything
    other than other core modules and config.h, confmagic.h, mushtypes.h,
    and options.h.
